ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A reading of a cross section of Renaissance Spanish novels from several genres. Useful for students studying or interested in Renaissance Spanish literature.

I would recommend this course to any fellow student without reservation, provided that they have any previous interest in the subject of Renaissance literature. Such an interest could then be fulfilled in many different ways, since the class discussion is indeed open to incorporate philosophy, art and othe disciplines into this field of knowledge.
I would recommend it; it covers a great spectrum of Spanish literature.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: The course requires reading a number of texts not on the reading lists which is good for general knowledge of Spanish literature. It would have been useful, however, to read a few more texts from the reading lists.
It added so much background that I lacked. Helped me understand influences an roots of ancient literature to more recent works.
